other_tests.findings: Confirmed scapholunate dissociation bilaterally with communication through the scapholunate ligament.
Immediate relief of numbness and tingling postoperatively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At last follow-up 6 months later, the patient continued to complain of mild wrist pain with twisting and lifting, but reported no new symptoms.

other_tests.findings: Severe unilateral instability and persistent pain.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up examination 15 months later revealed no symptoms and no weakness.

other_tests.findings: Reported mild or no pain in most cases, with slight worsening symptoms in one case.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Previously reported symptoms remained unchanged in multiple cases.
